title.native: アガサ・クリスティーの名探偵ポワロとマープル
title.romaji: Agatha Christie no Meitantei Poirot to Marple
title.english: Agatha Christie's Great Detectives Poirot and Marple

description: Young Mabel West is the daughter of mystery writer Raymond West, who wants her to lead a normal life. Rebelling against this, Mabel wants to be a great detective, and sets out for London to become assistant to none other than Hercule Poirot, the great Belgian detective who resides there. She finally wins the reluctant approval of her father, and embarks on an exciting life of mystery and suspense - his only demand being that she occasionally spend some time with her great-aunt, Jane Marple, in the small village of St. Mary Mead.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

node.description: Dame Agatha Mary Clarissa Christie, Lady Mallowan, DBE (née Miller; 15 September 1890 – 12 January 1976) was an English writer known for her 66 detective novels and 14 short story collections, particularly those revolving around fictional detectives Hercule Poirot and Miss Marple. She also wrote the world's longest-running play The Mousetrap and six romances under the pseudonym Mary Westmacott. In 1971, she was appointed a Dame Commander of the Order of the British Empire (DBE) for her contribution to literature.

He is a composer and arranger who has scored several films and anime, most notably the Mothra films in the 1990s. He is the son of legendary tokusatsu and anime composer, [Chuumei Watanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/169740).

Her husband passed away from a brain hemorrhage on May 23, 2020.
Freelancer. Originating from Jungle Gym.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/dakenmukuinugam)

[Website](http://mariyat.co.jp/)

A Japanese singer and songwriter who helped pioneer the style of Japanese adult-oriented rock/soft rock dubbed "city pop." Mariya Takeuchi has produced the majority of her music since the '70s. She is well known for interpreting "Plastic Love", contributing to the revival in interest in the City Pop genre in recent years.

Takeuchi is one of the most commercially successful Japanese solo artists in the history of the Japanese album chart, having sold over 16 million records, and has received several accolades. She is the oldest singer to have achieved a No. 1 single.

Married to [Tatsurou Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/114944/Tatsurou-Yamashita). They have one daughter.

(Source: Wikipedia)
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/高橋ナオヒト)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yonemura_s)
Formerly an animator.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nabeshin_afro)__ __Shinichi Watanabe__ is a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist for anime, while also being a voice actor. Shinichi is best known for his over-the-top adaption of Rikudo Koshi's [Excel Saga](https://anilist.co/anime/379/Heppoko-Jikken-Animation-Excel-Saga), in which he appears as the character Nabeshin. In addition to his appearance in Excel Saga and [Puni Puni Poemy](https://anilist.co/anime/564/Puni-PuniPoemii), his likeness has also appeared as NB in [Tenchi Muyo! GXP](https://anilist.co/anime/1133/Tenchi-Muyo-GXP), Inu-Afro in [Dotto Koni-Chan](https://anilist.co/anime/1684/Dotto-Konichan) and in small role in [Mahoromatic](https://anilist.co/anime/276/Mahoromatic). He also does an unmistakable cameo of Nabeshin, which can be seen in [Nurse Witch Komugi](https://anilist.co/anime/615/Nurse-Witch-Komugichan/), although Shinichi had nothing to do with that project. In addition he made an appearance in the show [EyeShield 21](https://anilist.co/anime/15/Eyeshield-21). More recently he made an appearance in episode 32 of [Hayate no Gotoku](https://anilist.co/anime/2026/Hayate-no-Gotoku). Shinichi claims that the nickname Nabeshin (which is an obvious combination of "nabe" in Watanabe, and "shin" in Shinichi) came from God himself. (Not to be confused with the director [Watanabe Shinichirou](https://anilist.co/staff/97009/Shinichirou-Watanabe), which is most known for directing Cowboy Bebop)
Frequent presence in [OLM](https://anilist.co/studio/28/OLM)'s productions.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/十川誠志)

Married to [Rika Nakase](https://anilist.co/staff/106605/).
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/藤田伸三)
Affiliated with [OLM](https://anilist.co/studio/28/). Originally a director, but shifted his focus to composite work when animation went digital.

__Susumu Aketagawa__ is a Japanese sound director and the representative director of Magic Capsule. His son, [Jin Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/103074), is also a sound director working at Magic Capsule.
